For example, without those sanctions, the bloc would probably find it difficult to force Iran to give the U.N.'s nuclear watchdog agency all the information it has requested on the country's past research on nuclear weapons.
The six powers are expected to resist Iran's demand because lifting the U.N. penalties first would reduce their leverage in demanding that Tehran live up to U.N. conditions.
So far Iran has been resisting the U.N.'s efforts to retrieve that information.
